feed.title: Category: The Week In Review | Hiking in Finland

entry.title: The Week In Review 252
entry.content:
“Mountaineering is not accessible to moral value judgements. And yet: People who regularly take big risks in the mountains must be considered either profoundly selfish, or incapable ot sympathy for those who love them.” - Robert Macfarlane

News

The Bikepacking Framebag Manufacturer List got an update with new European & US-American manufacturers!

K2, Völkl, Marker: Top Sports Brands are up for Sale.

Drink Ice Cream Beer to fight Global Warming.

Win a pretty XXL Outdoor Calendar. [German]

Great discussion over on my The Power of Gear Photos post - weigh in with your opinion!

Cool? A bike lock that makes thieves immediately vomit.

Bloggers: Join the Bergfreunde.co.uk Affiliate Programme and earn with your blog and gear reviews!

Don’t Date a Girl Who Treks.

Will one of the hardest climbs on the Planet soon see a Second Ascent?

Buy Experiences, Not Things.

Ulirich introduces you to the beautiful Lightcatcher Art Project. [German]

Looking for the World’s lightest hardshell? Maybe it’s the Montane Minimus 777 Pull-On Jacket!

Carabiner Coffee.

Join the Go Out MYOG Camp next weekend!

Subscribe to the Packrafting-Store Newsletter to not miss your chance on buying a used packraft for a great price! The current one is full of useful information for packrafters, too, and announces new gear like the colourful drysuits, optional spraydecks for the MRS Ponto and Adventure X2 packrafts and the smart Internal Storage System, which lets you store your equipment on the inside of your raft. There’s also some nice fall specials which let you safe €$£ on a selfbailing packraft and in the Instagram photo competetion you can earn a voucher for your next purchase! Thus all-in-all one of these Newsletters which you’re happy to see in your inbox, and with the chance of saving quite a few Euros on a packraft you really want to subscribe.

Need gear for the next autumn or winter trip? Bergfreunde still have 50% off in their outlet.

Get 20% Off Socks at Backcountry.

Trip Reports

Autumn Backpacking in the Dolomites.

A hike to the Rietburg. [German]

Chad got up early with his ultralight pack for an hike to Mt Roger’s & Grayson Highlands.

The Lost Coast, Part 2.

Escaping the fog on the Jura High-Route. [German]

The 2016 Kelpie Kampout.

Weissmies, 4017 m high. [Polish]

The 3rd Pillar of Nalumasortoq.

Gerald hikes the Via Dinarica into Croatia. [German]

In Praise of Weekend Warriors.

Sven is back on his Mountainbike after 20 years. [German]

Grand Canyon 2016.

Matthias finished his 3.000 km hike through Austria - congratulations!

Hiking the Via Alta Verzasca.

Retruning to Europe through Eastern Germany.

And Sabine is no longer a backpacker. [German]

Gear Reviews

Dennis reviews the Páramo Pasco Jacket.

The World’s Most Rugged Packs.

DIY Detergent from chestnuts. [German]

A Bikepacker’s Guide to Mountain Weather preparation.

Sven tests the Salomon S-Lab Sense 5 Ultra [German] and Jakob takes the Brooks Mazama out for a run.

If you enjoyed this post and would like more, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Disclaimer: There are affiliate links in this article to help finance the website. Additionally the Packrafting Store supported this post, too. Read the Transparency Disclaimer for more information on affiliate links & blogger transparency.

entry.title: The Week In Review 251
entry.content:
“How often when we are comfortable, we begin to long for something new!” ― Jacob Grimm

News

Social Hiking turned six this weekend - Happy Birthday!

Why to try running without a watch.

A Tour of the Arc’teryx design studio and factory in Vancouver, Canada.

As Tucas gives away a Sestrals Blanket in a Fundraising campaign for LAUFBURSCHE.

TrailGroove Issue 30 is out.

Awesome: GQ publishes a slightly sexist climbing piece and Outdoor Research stepped in with a perfect response.

Paul ponders about the AliExpress wormhole.

More news & pondering on Summit Crosses.

Check out the UNBOUNDED Patagonia Documentary

Less than a week after GoPro announced their Karma Drone DJI releases the Mavic, the lightest and most compact 4K Drone to date. Exiting!

Long-distance hiking review September. [German]

Yosemite Ranger Discovers Park’s True Owners.

Save an Extra 25% in the REI End of Summer Clearance!

Trip Reports

Rufus first proper backpacking trip looked amazing!

James kicks off his Colorado Trail trip report.

Bikepacking on the Mainradweg. [German]

Mt. Whitney & Mt. Langley in a Weekend.

Treriksröset.

A sweet Cairngorms Bikepacking Loop.

Gerald continues hiking across the globe, this time his adventures take him to the Drakensberge.

Race Report from the 1000seen Marathon. [German]

Chuska Mountain Bikepacking Traverse.

Beardoh and SweetPea reached Canada - Congratz!

The riddle of Snow Lake and the glacier with no outlet.

Basin & Range Unscripted Series: Episode 1 Mimi Kvinge.

Day 3 on the Wind River High Route.

A hike through the dry Rio Seco river bed. [German]

Gear Reviews

GoPro HERO4 Session Review.

Review of the small Leatherman Squirt PS4.

Arkel Seatpacker Review.

DIY Hammock Half Bug Net (HUG) Instructions.

And make sure to check out the Interbike Bikepacking Awards.

If you enjoyed this post and would like more, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Disclaimer: There are affiliate links in this article to help finance the website. You either can avoid them like hell or click them and buy gear and apparel via them to support me. Read the Transparency Disclaimer for more information on affiliate links & blogger transparency.

entry.title: The Week In Review 250
entry.content:
“There is a charm about the forbidden that makes it unspeakably desirable.” — Mark Twain

250 The Week In Reviews! The first outdoor-themed, curated week review hits 250 issues! If you enjoyed this post and the many before it and would like more in the future, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. Any help is appreciated and allows me to create more epic content for you!

News

Superb xkcd comic about the Earth Temperature Timeline.

We’d never kill an albatross or gorilla - but we let others do it on our behalf.

Awesome: France bans plastic cups, plates and cutlery. I reckon Ti Sporks and spoons will get rather popular soon!

How to Live in the Wilderness for a Whole Year.

How Patagonia uses storytelling to turn Consumers into Activists.

The Packrafting-Store now offers a Internal Storage System as an upgrade to your existing packraft!

The Outdoors in Your Postbox. Because writing your outdoor friends real postcards rocks!

Lots of inspiring #ItsGreatOutThere posts out there, here’s a few: Berghasen, Greyguide, Matschbar and lebedraussen!

Should Photographers use Snapchat or Instagram?

Time millionaires. A year without work. [German]

Add Instant Ramen to the list of Foods that can kill you.

Episode 11 of the Mountain Podcast is out.

The Backcountry Boiler has a new website and is in stock, ready to be shipped!

Pre-order this awesome Scotland 2017 Calendar.

Read Cross purposes and weigh in - do crosses belong on mountain tops or not?

Ladies, check out “Lael’s Globe of Adventure” Women’s Scholarship!

Bergfreunde.co.uk is now AlpineTrek.co.uk and while the summer sales are over you still can find some nice bargains, like the Arc’teryx Atom LT Hoody which is 40% off.

Have you checked out the deal of the day at ULA-Equipment.com yet?

REI Garage - It’s the new way to find a great deal!

Trip Reports

Inspiring: Bikepacking British Columbia’s Chilcotin Range.

The Wow factor is high: Willem returns from Greenland.

All good things are three: Luc’s Gates of the Arctic Traverse is also pretty epic.

Go on some Family Adventures in the Bregenzerwald.

The Walking Womad is out for some Dayhiking around Zermatt.

Friends don’t let friends belay.

Linda visits Paradise Park.

Katharina and Henryk are on a Roadtrip with Flamingos.

享受純粹的「出走」樂趣. [Chinese]

家族で雲ノ平へ. [Japanese]

Kyrgyzstan Journal Pt. 3.

Sweet: Los Tres Volcanes, Ecuador.

What’s it like to be a Pembrokeshire Local?

Bikepacking Nanegalito Pachijal.

Sam writes about Spooking Elk and Stalking Mule Deer.

Spring on the Pacific Crest Trail.

Basin & Range Unscripted Series: Episode 2 - Community Skis.

Gear Reviews

How FRAKTA became an UL MYOG Backpack. [German]

Building a Bike for the Baja Divide.

Jörg tests the Asics Trabuco 4 GTX. [German]

Therm-a-Rest NeoAir All Season review.

You’re a photographer? Check out Alex’s iPad mobile photography workflow.

Check out seven new bikes with a lot of adventure potential from the 2016 Interbike Outdoor Demo.

Footsteps of Giants: The bike.

Im Zelt von Wigald Boning book review. [German]

If you enjoyed this post and would like more, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Disclaimer: There are affiliate links in this article to help finance the website. You either can avoid them like hell or click them and buy gear and apparel via them to support me. Read the Transparency Disclaimer for more information on affiliate links & blogger transparency.

entry.title: The Week In Review 249
entry.content:
“Real adventure is not polished. It’s not the result of some marketing budget, there’s no hashtag for it. It burns brightest on the maps edges but it exists in all of us. It exists at the intersection of imagination and the ridiculous. You have to have faith, it will find you there. And when it does, remember, there’s just one question. In this life, when the road comes to the end, will you keep pedalling?” - Kyle Dempster

News

Yvon Chouinard has revised his classic Let My People Go Surfing, the lessons of an reluctant business man.

Lets help LAUFBURSCHE some more!

Inside the Strange Brain of the World’s Greatest Solo Climber.

Small houses with a big future. [German]

But only once this gets solved (in the US at least): Tiny Homes’ biggest Problem is that the law can’t decide what they are.

Get Out Into Nature Because #ItsGreatOutThere.

Join the Bergfreunde.co.uk Affiliate Programme and earn with your blog and gear reviews!

Apple announces new Apple Watch app for hikers.

Help the Schrecksee! [German]

Reserve your bunk or room at one of the 91 Mountain Huts of the Austrian Alpenverein now online! A great step forward as up until now you always needed to call in for a reservation. [German]

Canada is gonna open a 22,000 km Car-Free Bike Path across the Country in 2017. #FuckCarsRideBikes

Coffeeneuring 2016: Save the Date!

Summit “crescent” stirs up Swiss hikers.

The new issue of Outdoor Enthusiast is now live and free to read.

Great tips for cycling with kids. [German]

How about an 480 g light sleeping bag made in Poland?

Need insulation for the next autumn trip? Consider the updated Patagonia Nano Puff Hoody or the 309 g light Patagonia Nano Air Light Hoody.

Check out the new arrivals from Salewa for the autumn and winter.

Last chance saloon: The Bergfreunde Summer Sale ends soon.

Trip Reports

Kyrgyzstan Journal Pt. 2.

Family Day in the Elan Valley.

Great trip report to Ladhak & Stok Kangri. [German]

Scientific Adventure: Greenland’s Caves & Climate Change.

The Gamskogel traverse. [German]

Jacob enjoyed the crumbling places of SEKI.

Final day on the epic Lost Coast north trip.

Hellhole Canyon, California.

Kåfjord.

The Dynafit Speed TransAlp Running Tour.

Indonesia - sun, waves & nasi campur. [German]

Thunder Mountain.

Gear Reviews

Swix Sonic Pro Trail Carbon 120 Trekking Pole Review.

Double Duty: Lightening Your Backpacking Load with Multi-Purpose Gear

Paulina tests the Adidas Outdoor Flyloft Jacket.

A bikepacking lesson.

How to choose the perfect Trail Shoe for Running And Hiking.

Stand Up Paddle Board Review: Go inflatable.

And Timo has a lot of (lightweight) gear for sale.

If you enjoyed this post and would like more, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!

Disclaimer: There are affiliate links in this article to help finance the website. You either can avoid them like hell or click them and buy gear and apparel via them to support me. Read the Transparency Disclaimer for more information on affiliate links & blogger transparency.

entry.title: The Week In Review 248
entry.content:
“Nothing compares to the simple pleasure of riding a bike.” – John F. Kennedy

News

The search for Kyle Dempster and Scott Adamson has been called off :(

Martin enlightens us with his long-distance hike review of August. [German]

Thoughts on camping in the Allgäu Alps, Part 2. [German]

A look how to make Bushcrafting ultralight.

Autumn is coming, get a Peak Design Shell Cover for your camera to protect it from the rain. And save 10% on it by clicking that link, too!

Dave explains how they backpack with an infant.

Winter is coming - but you still can get 50% off on Winter Apparel and Gear at Backcountry.

The new 2016/ 2017 gear from Fjällräven, Patagonia, Arc’teryx, Mammut and Icebreaker is now available at Bergfreunde.co.uk.

Trip Reports

Colorado River to Mt. Peale Traverse.

Pita has a good time in Norway.

Paulina climbs North Peak and Mt. Conness.

In less than ten hours around the Zugspitze. [German]

Also Day 5 on the Lost Coast was more Type 2 Fun.

Cool Briançon Climbs in summer.

Alpine Defined - Emma Twyford in Chamonix from Rab on Vimeo.

Awesome & beautiful Cross Country Sierra Traverse.

Equally inspiring is Joe’s ride through Kyrgyzstan.

Hiking & packrafting in Finnish Lapland. [German]

Backpacking to the Conrad Kain Hut.

A walk at Stillwater River.

Braving the Stormy Seas for a Whale Watching Tour in Iceland.

Check out Jackie’s 9-Month Solo RTW Trip Video.

Gear Reviews

Ben reviews the Osprey Talon 33 and finds it versatile enough for everything.

Peter shares his first impressions of his new Seabird Scott MV HDPE.

Nice MYOG Dyneema X Backpack.

Sven tests the ACTIVEON CX Gold Action Cam. [German]

Casey reviews the Sea To Summit’s Ember Eb1 quilt and UltraLight Insulated Mattress.

Sourcing Water from the Trail in Japan.

Quasi explains how to shower when bikepacking. [German]

Ultralight Bike Touring in the Alps.

And Dave got a Teardrop Trailer called Wilma.

If you enjoyed this post and would like more, why not support me with a coffee or two? I work Full-Time on Hiking in Finland to bring you inspiring trip reports, in-depth gear reviews and the latest news from the outdoors. You also could subscribe to the rarer-than-ever Newsletter and follow along on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube for more outdoorsy updates!
